IE even displays this part of the page correctly!
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (19:20): If you have a stylesheet, how can you make the images relative to the stylesheet and not the HTML file?
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (19:20): Is that just the way it is?
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:20): if the image is actually an IMAGE then it's an img tag and is part of the document and won't change with style
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (19:21): if the image is styling markup which doesn't really matter, you're encouraged to use div backgrounds etc
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (19:21): Yeah, but are the relative to the HTML file or the CSS f ile.
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (19:21): I have a directory with my HTML file, and then one directory up I have my stylesheets, than one more directory up I have my images.
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (19:22): I use that one stylesheet sitewide from directories much farther down.
49ec94fc4c90faefd08e2ce20017e132 (19:23): Should I define the image's location relatively all the way from the file, or just from my CSS sheet?
49c858400ee501dea98aa0148fced455 (19:34): how can I aling (up-downs way, no left-right) a text in a span tag?
